election_record.label: New York 1819 State Senate, Eastern District

sub_unit.name: Essex
sub_unit.note: Benjamin Mooers received 1 vote as Benjamin More.
Duncan MacMartin, Jr. received 55 votes as Duncan MacMartin.
Thomas Frothingham received 1 vote as Thomas Frothing.

sub_unit.name: Franklin
sub_unit.note: Benjamin Mooers received 17 votes as Benjamin Moore.

sub_unit.name: Herkimer
sub_unit.note: Duncan MacMartin, Jr. received 51 votes as Duncan MacMartin.

The New-York Evening Post (New York, NY), May 12, and The Daily Advertiser (New York, NY) report 884 votes for Benjamin Mooers, 808 for Duncan MacMartin, 717 for Thomas Frothingham, 840 for Herman Knickerbacker, 840 for Robert Hudson, 101 for James L. Hogeboom, 41 for Thomas Sammons, and 841 for Richard M. Esselstyne.

sub_unit.name: Jefferson
sub_unit.note: Benjamin Mooers received 221 votes as Benjamin Moore.
Duncan MacMartin, Jr. received 2 votes as Duncan MacMartin.
Herman Knickerbacker received 5 votes as Hiram Kinckerbacker.

sub_unit.name: Lyme
sub_unit.note: It appears that votes from Lyme Township were not counted in the Official Canvass.
Herman Knickerbacker received 5 votes as Hiram Knickerbacker.

sub_unit.name: Lewis
sub_unit.note: Duncan MacMartin, Jr. received 46 votes as Duncan MacMartin.

sub_unit.name: Montgomery
sub_unit.note: Duncan MacMartin, Jr. received 15 votes as Duncan MacMartin.
Richard M. Esselstyne received 19 votes as Richard Esselstyne and 1 vote as Richard N. Esselstyne.
Benjamin Mooers received 1 vote as Benjamin Moore.
Duncan MacMartin, Jr. received 20 votes as Duncan MacMartin.
The Cabinet, May 12, and The New-York Evening Post (New York, NY), May 12, report 1488 votes for Benjamin Mooers in Montgomery county, though the town votes listed add up to 1482.

sub_unit.name: Rensselaer
sub_unit.note: Duncan MacMartin, Jr. received 29 votes as Duncan MacMartin and 1 vote as Duncan M. Martin, Jr.
Herman Kinckerbacker received 1 vote as H. Knickerbacker.

sub_unit.name: Hoosick
sub_unit.note: The Northern Budget, May 11, reports 125 votes for Asa Stower and no votes for Thomas Sammons in Hoosick.

sub_unit.name: Pittstown
sub_unit.note: The Northern Budget, May 11, reports 103 votes each for Duncan MacMartin, Jr. and James L. Hogeboom in Pittstown.

sub_unit.name: Schodack
sub_unit.note: The Lansingburgh Gazette, May 11, reports 121 votes for Robert Hudson in Schodack.
The Northern Budget, May 11, reports no votes for Thomas Frothingham and Duncan MacMartin, Jr. in Schodack.

sub_unit.name: Saint Lawrence
sub_unit.note: Benjamin Mooers received 34 votes as Benjamin Moore.
Duncan MacMartin, Jr. received 35 votes as Duncan MacMartin.

sub_unit.name: Ballston
sub_unit.note: The Cabinet, May 19, reports 4 votes for James L. Hogeboom and no votes for Asa Stower in Ballston.

sub_unit.name: Charlton
sub_unit.note: The Cabinet, May 19, reports 44 votes for Benjamin Mooers and 43 for Thomas Frothingham in Charlton.

sub_unit.name: Corinth
sub_unit.note: The Cabinet, May 19, reports 9 votes for Herman Knickerbacker and no votes for Robert Hudson in Corinth.

sub_unit.name: Hadley
sub_unit.note: Herman Knickerbacker received 1 vote as John Kinckerbacker.

sub_unit.name: Malta
sub_unit.note: The Cabinet, May 19, reports 12 votes for Herman Knickerbacker and 13 for Robert Hudson in Malta.

sub_unit.name: Northumberland
sub_unit.note: The Cabinet, May 19, reports 28 votes for Benjamin Mooers in Northumberland.

sub_unit.name: Saratoga
sub_unit.note: The Cabinet, May 19, reports 92 votes for Benjamin Mooers, 68 for Duncan MacMartin, Jr., 63 for Thomas Frothingham, and 78 for James L. Hogeboom in Saratoga.

sub_unit.name: Waterford
sub_unit.note: The Cabinet, May 19, reports 21 votes for James L. Hogeboom and 24 for Asa Stower in Waterford.

sub_unit.name: Wilton
sub_unit.note: Herman Knickerbacker received 23 votes as Thomas Knickerbacker.

sub_unit.name: Schenectady
sub_unit.note: Duncan MacMartin, Jr. received 1 vote as Duncan MacMartin.
Benjamin Mooers received 1 vote as B. Mooers.

sub_unit.name: Princetown
sub_unit.note: The Cabinet, May 5, reports 28 votes for James L. Hogeboom in Princetown.

sub_unit.name: Three
sub_unit.note: The Cabinet, May 5, reports 41 votes for Thomas Frothingham in Ward 3.
Benjamin Mooers received 1 vote as B. Mooers.

sub_unit.name: Four
sub_unit.note: Duncan MacMartin, Jr. received 1 vote as Duncan MacMartin.
The Cabinet, May 5, reports 83 votes for Benjamin Mooers in Ward 4.

sub_unit.name: Warren
sub_unit.note: Duncan MacMartin, Jr. received 20 votes as Duncan MacMartin.

election_record.reference: Orange County Patriot; or, the Spirit of Seventy-Six (Goshen, NY). April 13, 1819.
Jefferson and Lewis Gazette (Watertown, NY). May 10, 1819.
The New-York Evening Post (New York, NY). May 12, 1819.
New York The Daily Advertiser (New York, NY). May 13, 1819.
